required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CMV-TCR-T Cells for CM Virus Infection After HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of CMV-TCR-T Cells in CM Virus Infection Diseases After HSCT

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single cente, single arm, open-label, phase I study to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of CMV-TCR-T cell immunotherapy in treating CMV virus infection after HSCT.

detailed_description.textblock: CMV infection is a common virus infection of HSCT, and which is highly related with the failure of transplantation and survival time of transplant patients. To evaluate the safety and efficacy of allogenic CMV-TCR-T cell therapy in subjects with CMV infection, patients with CMV emias or deseases will be enrolled, and donor derived CMV-TCR-T(HLA-A*1101\0201\2402) cells will be intravenously infused with a escalated dose of 0.1-1×106 CMV-TCR-T cells. The CMV DNA copies and CMV-TCR-T cell proliferation will be monitored in the scheduled time (day 0, day 4, day 7, day 10, day 14, day 28).

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with adverse events.

clinical_study.condition: CMV Infection or Reactivation After Allogenic HSCT

arm_group.description: The patients will receive one dose of CMV-TCR-T.The dosage ranges from 0.1×10^6 to 1×10^6 TCR+T/Kg.

intervention.description: Patients with CMV emias or CMV disease will be enrolled, and donor derived CMV-TCR-T(HLA-A*1101\0201\2402) cells will be intravenously infused with a escalated dose of 0.1-1×106 CMV-TCR-T cells. The CMV DNA copies and CMV-TCR-T cell proliferation will be monitored in the scheduled time (day 0, day 4, day 7, day 10, day 14,day 28).
